intro: Erigeron versicolor, commonly known as the blueweed or blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy blue to purple ray flowers surrounding a yellow disk, creating a striking visual display. It typically grows in moist meadows, prairies, and along stream banks, preferring full sun to partial shade. Erigeron versicolor is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
